newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends down, underpinned by fund buying.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends down, underpinned by fund buying.

text.p: WCE canola futures ended lower but off the day's lows, underpinned by fund demand and a partial recovery in CBOT soycomplex futures, traders said.

"The May (canola) fell $6 at the open on the bearish USDA ending (soy) stocks but the beans came back. Funds bought 1,500 May, crushers bought 1,000 May and July," a trader said. May WCE futures crush profit margin rose to -4.74 Tuesday from -3.60 Monday. Mar-May spread at $6, May-July $0.30, 300 May-Nov $53.50, July-Sept $43. Volume was 8,285 lots, or 165,700 tonnes, with 2,875 hedge lots.
Japan bought 3,000-4,000 tonnes cash canola overnight, sources said.

May canola closed $1.90 lower at $428.30 and July was down $1.80 at $428.60. May flax rose $0.20 to end at $361.20 and July fell $1.60 to $360.50. RBC-DS sold 200 May hedges, traders said. Volume 494.
March feed wheat rose $1 to $177.50 on commercial demand and Alberta Wheat Pool bought May up $1.90 to $172, traders said. Volume 700.
March western barley rose $0.30 to $144, May lost $0.50 to $145. UGG sold Mar-May at $1.50, traders said. Volume 1,400.
Feed peas and oats did not trade.
(All values in Canadian dollars, except feed peas)
